title: 114_hr4302
content: The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating all functions of the Bank as outlined in the Act. Functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. The Secretary must report this determination to Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act by administering and dissolving functions transferred to them, settling outstanding obligations of the Federal Government from terminated programs, and resolving any remaining affairs of the Bank. They can delegate these functions and must ensure that no positions or functions of the Bank exist after 60 days of its abolishment. Additionally, there are conforming amendments and repeals outlined in the Act. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including various sections from Acts such as the Export-Import Bank Act Amendments of 1978 and the Bank Export Services Act. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions, including sections from Acts like the Export-Import Bank Act Amendments of 1978 and the Bank Export Services Act, are repealed. Additionally, various sections from Acts such as the Enhancement Act of 1983, the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 1990, the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988, and title 31 of the United States Code are amended or eliminated. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related provisions are repealed, including amendments to title 31 of the United States Code. This includes the elimination of positions at level iii and iv, as well as the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related provisions are repealed, including the elimination of the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the abolishment date. Additionally, a report containing suggestions for other necessary amendments to Federal statutes will be submitted to the relevant Committees by the Secretary. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal laws, orders, rules, or documents to a department or office affected by this Act will now refer to the new department or office. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. "Function" includes duties, powers, and programs. "Office" includes various organizational entities.
